EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Station at (-14.0, -15.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (24.0, -15.0)
- Wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5) for coal storage

### Iron Ore Mining Station at (-14.0, 23.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, 23.0)
- Wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5) for iron ore storage

### Iron Smelting Area at (-10.0, 20.0)
Consists of:
- Stone furnace at (-11.0, 20.0)
- Stone furnace at (-9.0, 20.0)

### Copper Processing Station at (22.0, 20.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0)
- Wooden chest at (20.5, 21.5) for copper ore storage
- Stone furnace at (24.0, 20.0)
- Wooden chest at (24.5, 17.5) for copper plate storage
- Burner inserter at (21.5, 21.5) moving items from mining drill to chest
- Burner inserter at (22.5, 20.5) moving items to furnace
- Burner inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving processed items to storage

ERROR TIPS

### Errors with belt connections
- Cannot connect transport belts directly from chests - must use inserters as intermediaries
- Ensure belt paths are valid and can be normalized before attempting to create connections
- When creating belt connections, verify that the start and end positions are reachable and form a valid path

### Entity placement coordination
- When setting up production lines, plan the layout carefully to ensure entities can properly connect to each other
- Consider the direction and positioning of inserters relative to other entities they need to interact with

### Resource management
- Multiple mining drills are out of fuel - implement a fuel management system
- Ensure mining drills and other burner entities are regularly supplied with coal
